column10: Programs include Job Readiness and Financial Literacy, CPS Truancy Dropout Prevention, Teen REACH after-school program, HIV/AIDS Outreach, Computer Literacy Trainings, Youth Employment, Life Skills, and The Juvenile Justice Outreach.

column1: A Knock at Midnight Basic Computer Literacy Training
column10: Basic computer literacy trainings encompass  introduction to Windows, basic PC operation, fundamentals of word processing (Microsoft Word), introduction to spread sheets (Microsoft Excel),  fundamentals of Microsoft PowerPoint, navigating the internet, and E-mail fundamentals to increase and improve basic computer literacy skills and/or improve employability.

column1: A Knock at Midnight Family Advocacy Center
column10: The Family Advocacy program is designed to develop family support systems that help families to identify their strengths and needs and develop strategies to resolve challenges and accomplish goals to improve their quality of life, leading families to sufficiency.  Assists families in working toward reunification.  Families are assessed for advocacy, mediation, prevention and Intervention strategies.  Many direct advocacy services and trainings are provided on-site and other services are provided through community linkages.

column1: A Knock at Midnight Teen REACH program
column10: The Teen REACH program was designed to create and expand the range of choices and opportunities that enable, empower and encourage youth to achieve positive growth and development, improve expectations and capacities for future success, and avoid and/or reduce risk-taking behavior.  The program curriculums encompass workshops and activities that improve academic performance, increase basic social skills, enhance life skills, heighten parental involvement and awareness, sustain positive adult mentor relationships, and raise participation.

column1: A Knock at Midnight Workforce Preparation
column10: Today's job market requires considerably more qualifications than in the past.  AKAM's Workforce Preparation training is designed to prepare you for such situations.  No matter what your goals are, our staff is committed to cultivating your skills and promoting self-sufficiency.  Workforce Preparation courses are four-week sessions, which occur Thursdays, from 2:30-4:30pm.  Objectives: Resume Preparation, Microsoft Office applications, Decorum & Attire, Employment Placement.

Crisis Text Line is free, 24/7 support for those in crisis. Text 741741 from anywhere in the US to text with a trained Crisis Counselor. column1: WIC Food and Nutrition Center - Catholic Charities
column10: The Special Supplemental Nutrition Program for Women, Infants and Children (WIC) is a USDA food and nutrition program administered by the IL Department of Human Services. Centers provide a variety of WIC-approved foods for eligible participants. The food centers also provide access to social services, nutritional education, job training and educational programs.

YCA exposes young people to hip-hop realist portraiture and teaches them how to create their own authentic narratives through a variety of arts education programs, including free weekly writing workshops and open mics for young poets, journalists, and emcees, and Louder Than A Bomb, the largest youth poetry slam in the country.

column1: YWCA of Metropolitan Chicago - Englewood Satellite
column10: Provides assistance to victims of sexual assault, educates about the effects of violence in our community and promotes general health and wellness through the Sexual Violence Support Services (SVSS). Current programs include: Counseling Services, Rape Crisis Hotlines, Education & Training, Medical and Legal Advocacy.

column1: YWCA of Metropolitan Chicago Rape Crisis Hotline
column10: Operating 24 hours a day, 7 days a week, the Rape Crisis Hotline provides survivors of sexual assault/abuse and their significant others immediate support, crisis intervention and referrals for the city of Chicago and surrounding suburbs. The volunteers and staff at the hotline have received extensive training in sexual assault crisis intervention. The Chicago Rape Crisis Hotline is also the Rape, Abuse and Incest National Network (RAINN) affiliate for the city of Chicago.
The Rape, Incest, and Sexual Exploitation (RISE) Children's Center is a free counseling center for survivors of sexual violence aged 3 to 17 years of age.
